title: Product Design Co-op - 12 month (Summer 2025 - 16 Months)
description: OverviewAbout Intuit, Inc.At Intuit, we get up every morning with our hearts beating fast, excited and driven by the knowledge that we're transforming the world of consumer and small business finance. We're obsessed with our customers, and because of our obsession, we're continually challenging and disrupting ourselves to improve their financial lives. It's why our products- like TurboTax and QuickBooks ‚Äî continue to resonate with 50 million consumers around the globe. We are a Fortune 500 fintech company, and Canada‚Äôs Best Places to work several years in a row.About The OpportunityAt Intuit, we believe that student hires are the next generation of tech entrepreneurs. Our internship program is focused on identifying high-potential university students and equipping them with the tools they need to succeed in the tech industry. We support students by fully integrating them into our teams and providing direct support from fellow technologists, encouraging participation in team-run learning sessions, sharing timely feedback, and giving the opportunity to share their work with the broader team.About The TeamWe're a small but mighty team of designers (visual, interaction and content), who work to deliver amazing customer experiences for our TurboTax and QuickBooks users. We're looking for a candidate who is passionate about user experience, learning and creative problem solving.Sound interesting? Hear what our previous co-op student had to say about their time with us:"If you're interested in UX/UI or Product Design, Intuit should be top of your list. Intuit is a design driven company that places a huge focus on user experience, which provided me various opportunities to develop my design and research skills throughout the term. I've always felt valued as a team member and was constantly encouraged to speak up about anything."Learn more about Intuit's famous Design 4 Delight process here - www.intuitlabs.com/design-for-delightWhat you'll bringTo be eligible for the role you must align with the following:Currently enrolled in post secondary educationA graduation date of no earlier than 4 months after the internship/co-op concludesNot require sponsorship to work within the role now or in the futureCome in 2x per week to our Toronto office (all of our co-op roles are hybrid)You're customer-obsessed and are passionate about creating products that resonate on an emotional level and drive business results.Strong fundamental knowledge of UX Design practices and tools such as design thinking, decision mapping, prototyping & wireframing, Figma, AdobeXD, conducting deep user research.You're ready to work on many projects at once, collaborating with a variety of Design & Product experts!How you will leadMake an impact in the lives of our customers through customer research, data and iterative prototyping to deliver amazing designs. Based on your skills and interests, you may have the opportunity to work on visual, interaction, or content design focused work. Collaborate with our team of designers, product managers, developers and marketers.Learn, a lot! Get ready to learn from the best in the design business and take your design skills to the next level.

title: Internship, Innovations
description: INNOVATION INTERN Duration 4 Months, January 6th to April 25th 2025Location 30 Eglinton Avenue West, MississaugaModel 3 days, on site, or as neededCalling all passionate and ambitious students! Any other related duties may be assigned by the manager.What you will needCurrently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Business or Marketing, or a related field.Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and meaningful insights.Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.Excellent communication skills.Apply now to embark on this exciting journey with us!Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ  KDP) est une entreprise de boissons moderne ayant une vision audacieuse qui vise √† offrir croissance et opportunit√©. Nous op√©rons avec un mod√®le d'affaires diff√©renci√© et un portefeuille de marques de classe mondiale, aliment√©s par une √©quipe talentueuse, engag√©e et ancr√©e dans nos valeurs. Aimeriez-vous vous joindre √† nous?Nous nous effor√ßons d'√™tre un employeur de choix, en offrant une culture et des opportunit√©s qui permettent √† nos quelque 28 000 employ√©s de grandir et de se d√©velopper. Nous offrons aussi √† nos employ√©s des programmes con√ßus pour vous permettre d'am√©liorer votre croissance et votre d√©veloppement professionnels, et ce, tout en nous assurant que vous vous sentez valoris√©s, inspir√©s et appr√©ci√©s au travail.Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ KDP) is a leading beverage company in North America, with a portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partners brands and powerful distribution capabilities to provide a beverage for every need, anytime, anywhere. title: Global Banking and Markets - THRIVE Summer Internship Program (Canada) - Summer 2025 [Scotiabank]
description: Requisition ID: 207239Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.Term: May ‚Äì August 2025Application Deadline: 10/6/2024Posted pursuant to Scotiabank's Special Measure Program under the Employment Equity Act and Canadian Human Rights Act.Why work for Scotiabank?Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. This is a place where you'll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we're passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy.Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.Is this role right for you?The THRIVE program is Scotiabank's premiere rotational program that allows undergraduate students who identify as part of one or more equity deserving groups, the opportunity to job shadow across Global Capital Markets, Corporate Banking, and Investment Banking and gain exposure across banking. For students who are keen on pursuing a career in banking, this 11-week program is designed to develop awareness across business lines, technical skills, and interpersonal skills. This program provides life-long learnings by means of job shadowing, mentorship, and classroom style education.Furthermore, successful completion of the THRIVE program allows students the opportunity to return in front office internships for the summer of 2025 in Global Capital Markets or Corporate and Investment Banking.What will my responsibilities look like?Job Shadowing: Summer analysts will have the opportunity to job shadow across Corporate Banking, Global Capital Markets, and Investment Banking. In this program, you'll learn the day-to-day across industry sectors and will have the opportunity to apply this knowledge across projects and activities.Mentorship: Throughout the summer you'll also benefit from a mentorship program that pairs you with mentors from Corporate and Investment Banking, and Global Capital Markets to support your learning and answer any questions you might have! You will also attend regular business line fireside talks to learn all the ins and outs of working in CIB and GCM at Scotiabank.Classroom: Within the THRIVE program, analysts receive exclusive access to Wall Street Prep courses, coding training, case competitions, Bloomberg learning, and other relevant workshops to polish and develop technical skills. Following your time in the classroom, you will gain exposure to top global executives across the bank to learn from their experiences and network.RequirementsDo you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? ‚Äì We'd love to work with you if: You are currently enrolled in an undergraduate program. You are in your second year of studies. You identify as at least one of the following:Woman pursuing a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) degreeBlack students Indigenous students Students with Disabilities You have a proven record of outstanding achievement in academic and extracurricular activities (e.g., part-time work, clubs, case competitions, etc.). You have a clearly defined interest in Finance and a keen desire to learn new concepts. You possess a high level of attention to detail, quantitative skills, and professional standards. You have strong written and verbal communication skills and have strong problem-solving skills.We thank all candidates for taking the time to apply; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.How do I apply?AboutFor students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you're interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below: Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot. Complete a short one-way video interview here . Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile and your transcript.To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.Scotiabank is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible candidate experience. If you require accessibility accommodations during the recruitment, selection, and/or onboarding processes, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs. We value the unique skills and experiences everyone brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Accommodations (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) at any stage of the recruitment life cycle will be provided upon request.Location(s): Canada : Ontario : TorontoScotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here . Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Sports Management Intern
description: Canlan Sports is the largest private sector owner and operator of recreational sports complexes in North America. title: AI2 Business Intelligence Intern/Co-op (WINTER 2025) [TD Bank]
description: Role Type:Internship/Co-opWork Term:Work Location:CanadaHours:37.5Pay Details:We're committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with a member of our HR Team and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.Job Description:TD Description All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer. Why TD?TD's Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us. A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That's our unique and inclusive culture.Department Overview Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. The Business Intelligence Co-op/Intern will perform a variety of activities, which may include:Develop and understand business drivers, definitions, and metrics to interpret findings, take action, and provide meaningful business intelligence solution.Develop and maintain specialized reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data from various systems including localized data-marts on Azure Cloud as well as other sources like: SQL Server, HOST/Mainframe Systems, Enterprise Data Warehouse(s) on DB2, and external data sources utilizing D&A reporting tools (i.e. SQL, Alteryx, Tableau, Databricks, Synapse Analytics, ADLS, MS Power BI, Python, etc.).Manage the repository of all reporting assets including and not limited to development scripts and objects, documentation, etc.Adopt, implement, and effectively evolve report automation standards.Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all reporting.Lead project and partner discussions to understand business requirements and associated value in support of overall business/function strategy.Job RequirementsCurrently enrolled in either a recognized undergraduate degree majoring in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Science, Statistics, Business, Data Analytics or related, with the intent of going back to school at the start of your work term. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we're here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing ‚Äì and so will you.Our Total Rewards PackageOur Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we're committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.Colleague Development If you're interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. description: Type De R√¥leInternship/Co-opSession De StageLieu de travail:CanadaHoraire37.5D√©tails De La R√©mun√©rationNous avons √† c≈ìur d‚Äôoffrir une r√©mun√©ration juste et √©quitable √† tous nos coll√®gues. En votre qualit√© de candidat ou de candidate, nous vous encourageons √† avoir une conversation franche avec votre recruteur et √† poser des questions sur la r√©mun√©ration, notamment les particularit√©s salariales de ce poste.Description Du PosteCOMPANY OVERVIEWTell us your story. TD‚Äôs technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.Our Leaders are committed to people development, career advancement and value diversity and inclusion.Job DescriptionThe analytics and data science teams across the bank are responsible for transforming TD into a data-driven organization. We are looking for someone who will be an ambitious and dedicated contributor to our team.Wealth Advanced Analytics, part of Wealth Data, Analytics & Reporting, provides analytical and strategic advice to our business leaders in order to make more informed/fact based decisionsThe team is a key influencer to drive one of Wealth's key strategic objectives to use advance analytics to create a competitive advantage and drive growth.This role is responsible for providing support to Wealth businesses and contributing to the execution of the team's key deliverables.The Wealth Advanced Analytics Co-op/Intern will perform a variety of activities, which may include:Data Science/Advanced Analytics: Participate in projects supporting a broad range of data driven solutions by applying a variety of techniques to build out models. Work with structured and unstructured data and prepare data sets for machine learning through integration, cleaning, feature engineering, scaling and transforming dataBusiness Insight Analysis: Support team by providing analytics and insights to recommend actions that will enable optimal business decisions and/or resolves complex business problems. Identify opportunities to drive business growth and value.Visualization: Provide data visualization support by employing various techniques to support the business in interpreting info and communicating implications and/or recommendations to the business.Business Intelligence: Design and develop dashboards and scorecards to support business needs, ensuring alignment of metrics across the organization.Data Management: Participate in projects by analyzing approaches, processes, and tools to support the business data strategy.Data Governance: Responsible for improving the trust in our data through the management of integration, availability, usability, quality, integrity and security of bank data.Targeted Deliverables: Participate as part of a team working on initiatives designed to improve decisions, processes, systems and applications which support our key businesses.QualificationsCurrently enrolled in a recognized undergraduate degree majoring in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Science, Statistics, Data Analytics or related, with the intent of going back to school at the start of your work term.Excellent verbal and written communication with the ability to work collaboratively and effectively in a team environment. Experience presenting in front of big crowds/senior leadership is a plus.Experience with analyzing large data sets, drawing insights and inferences, and communicating outputs.Experienced in one or more of:Big Data ‚Äì Programming, Data/Text Mining, Optimization, Algorithm Development, Automation, Data Visualization, SimulationMachine Learning ‚Äì Predictive Analytics, Regression, Logit Modeling, Discrete Choice, Propensity Modeling, Natural Language Processing.Reading and comprehending data schemas, metadata, entity relationship diagrams and other technical documentationTechnical knowledge or experience with Cloud environments (MS Azure is a plus) as well as experience with Data Management.Strong technical knowledge and experience with one or more of: Python, Spark/PySpark, SQL, Alteryx or TableauExperience with Data Management, Analytics, and Project Management is a plus.Strong statistical and analytical skills as well as a passion for analytics are necessary.Additional InformationThis position is a 4-month work term and will commence January 6th ‚Äì April 25th, 2025.Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangementsTD is committed to providing you with the best candidate experience and internship in these unique circumstances. As such, work location and start dates are subject to change.HOURSMonday-Friday, standard business hours.INCLUSIVENESSAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. title: Canadian Banking - Marketing & Communications Internship/Co-op - Winter 2025 [Scotiabank]
description: Requisition ID: 206544Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.Term: January - April 2025Application Deadline: 10/18/2024There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you'll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love ‚Äì all while getting paid to do it! There's a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership, and Opportunity).Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:Support the team by managing business-as-usual updates and new requests for resources and supporting material. Support new requests and updates for marketing resources. Help evolve and improve the user experience by exploring internal and external best practices. Work with business partners on the creation of relevant, timely material. Assist in tracking efforts, establishing KPI reporting, and performing necessary analysis to organize information and draw actionable insights. RequirementsDo you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? ‚Äì We'd love to work with you if:You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitionsYou have a high level of competency with MS Office suite. You have strong written and verbal communication skills. You can manage multiple tasks at once and are adaptable with priorities. You can create engaging slide decks and have experience in creative projects. What's in it for you?You'll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.How do I apply?AboutFor students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you're interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below:Complete your PLUM Profile here and save it as a screenshot.Complete a short one-way video interview here Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps aboveLocation(s): Canada : Ontario : TorontoScotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here . Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Intern - Investments, Total Fund Management, Global Trading (Winter 2025- 4 Month Contract)
description: The Deadline To Apply For This Role IsUntil 11:59 PM of September 29, 2024The OpportunityJanuary 2025-April 2025When you work in an internship role in the Total Fund Management department you will have an engaging work experience where you can apply your analytical skills and passion for markets at a leading investment firm while experiencing the dynamic nature of the trading floor environment. This full immersion experience unfolds in a friendly and open environment where you will work side by side with highly experienced investment professionals and more recent graduates. We embrace diversity of thought and pride ourselves in our strong learning culture. You will be encouraged to offer your opinion and develop both market expertise and strengthen interpersonal skills. As an added benefit, our interns have access to industry tools, research, and an invaluable opportunity to interact with traders, portfolio managers, economic researchers and banks.Who You‚Äôll Work WithWe are looking to fill one internship position in our Global Trading team within Total Fund Management. Global trading provides execution capabilities to all asset groups and regions, with a focus on minimizing costs while continually improving the execution process. The team is comprised of subject matter experts on market liquidity in various asset classes, who help the portfolio management teams bring trades and realize market ideas in the most efficient way possible.What You'll DoAs an intern in Total Fund Management, you will be encouraged to make the most of your experience at OTPP by asking questions and getting involved in our daily business right from Day 1. Total Fund Management encourages the development of their interns and offers a unique experience with direct exposure to markets in an institutional capacity.During the internship, you will work with a team of traders across various asset classes. The successful candidate will gain a wide array of experience across equities, commodities, fixed income, and FX in global markets.Every day is different on the trading floor and requires a team to collaborate and solve problems in real-time. As a member of the team, you will be required to help tackle ad-hoc problems. You may contribute by building tools that help traders negotiate transactions, research and present findings on different market microstructures or automating trading processes.What You'll NeedSeeking a 3rd or 4th year undergraduate or graduate student. The intern candidate should possess outstanding academic records and have demonstrated strong leadership ability through involvement in extracurricular endeavors such as student government, student run financial groups, athletics, and entrepreneurial activities.The Ideal Candidate Will Possess The FollowingCurrently working towards a degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field Strong understanding and passion for financial markets, instruments, trading strategies, and the global economy Ability to interpret and analyze large financial datasets, economic indicators, and market trends, and derive actionable insights Experience with programming languages is an asset, but not required Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically under pressure Excellent communication skills to articulate trading strategies and market views effectively A proactive and self-motivated attitude with a continuous desire to learn and improve Experience working in a team-oriented environment with a collaborative mindset What We‚Äôre OfferingNumerous opportunities for professional growth and development, including lunch and learnsStudent led team building events on a monthly basisEmployee discount programs including Edvantage and PerkopolisAt Ontario Teachers', diversity is one of our core strengths. We take pride in ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create, reflect and embrace diversity of thought, background and experience. Through our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion strategy and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), we celebrate diversity and foster inclusion through events for colleagues to connect for professional development, networking & mentoring. We are building an inclusive and equitable workplace where our talent is respected, accepted and empowered to be themselves. To learn more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, check out Life at Teachers'.How To ApplyAre you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Apply today! The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:ResumeCopy of your transcriptsYou will also be invited to complete a pre-recorded digital interview as part of your application.We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.Accommodations are available upon request (peopleandculture@otpp.com) for candidates with a disability taking part in the recruitment process and once hired.The privacy of your personal information is important to us. Please visit our Privacy Centre to learn how we handle your personal information.Functional AreasAdministrationRequisition ID5992

title: Velocity - Data Scientist Internship/Co-Op - Winter 2025
description: Requisition ID: 205875Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.Term: January 2025 ‚Äì May 2025Application Deadline: September 27th, 2024Ready to Start your Journey with Scotiabank? Apply Now!For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships‚ÄØover resumes and are eager to learn about you, your interests, and your potential.Please Follow The Steps Below To Successfully ApplyStep 1: Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.Step 2: Complete a short one-way video interview here.Step 3: Complete a coding test through Codility to showcase your technical skills by solving job-related problems. Please make sure to have this Codility test completed prior to applying through our career site. When you're ready, click here to begin the assessment.Step 4: Once you have completed your Plum Profile, one-way video interview and Codility test, apply to the role on our website. You only need to complete this one!To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love ‚Äì all while getting paid to do it! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. After successfully completing a co-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:Collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging data science solutions Leverage distributed computing tools (e.g., Spark, Cloud) for analysis, data mining, and modeling Collaborate with data engineering, software developer, and other analytics teams to build analytical dataset and model Create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure, conduct testing to measure the effectiveness of models, and make ongoing changes Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models, and algorithms used and developed Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes Work on challenging and research-based initiatives using advanced machine learning methods focusing on data-driven outcomes Experiment & learn! You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and hackathons. You have knowledge/experience in: Cleaning, transforming, and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files) Big Data/Cloud ecosystem (e.g., GCP) Experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning Python programming Common machine learning libraries in Python, PySpark (scikit-learn, xgboost) UNIX tools and shell scripting SQL skills for querying relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL) Visualization tools like PowerBI Kubernetes Git Workflows (Pull Request, Code Review, Branching) What‚Äôs in it for you?You‚Äôll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team. Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more! title: Strategic Initiatives & Risk Management Intern / Co-Op
description: Role Type:Internship/Co-opWork Term:Winter/Term 2Work Location:CanadaHours:37.5Pay Details:We‚Äôre committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with a member of our HR Team and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.Job Description:Department OverviewTD Direct Investing is Canada‚Äôs largest direct investing brokerage, empowering self-directed investors and traders with its full spectrum of powerful solutions and innovative tools to manage their investments with ease and confidence. As Canada‚Äôs leading direct investing brokerage, we have a proud heritage of innovation that is driven by the fundamental beliefthat independent investors deserve better. We remain passionately motivated by this belief and are committed to putting clients first, creating legendary employee experiences, and achieving superior results by working with integrity.As a member of the TD Direct Investing (DI) National Office team, you will have the opportunity to work with results oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people who share your passion to help our clients and one another to succeed.Job Description Reporting to the Senior Manager, Strategic Initiatives & Risk Management, the successful candidate will play a key role and be part of a pioneering Risk Management (1A) team focusing on building deep insights and intelligence on the active and sophisticated trader segments to help define and manage risk exposures, drive data-driven decisions, and support overall business objectives.Key Accountabilities Will Include:Proactively monitor for potential risk exposure of the active trader segment with aim to preemptively manage credit and market riskCompile active trader and high value client segment reporting to track key segment performance (segment profitability, risk metrics, margin lending, sector concentration, trading activity, etc.) and drive data-based decision makingPrepare structured analyses, often in time-sensitive circumstances, and be able to summarize key insights into a coherent, concise communication suitable for executive consumptionBuild robust processes and documentation in support of Credit & Risk, or regulatory and control requirementsJob RequirementsKnowledge of and familiarity or hands-on experience with self-directed investing platforms. Stocks and options trading knowledge preferred.Specializing or majoring in a business/finance, mathematics, engineering, or risk management focusExcellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret raw and complex sets of data, turning them into digestible summaries and actionable recommendationsFamiliarity in Excel and PowerPoint, including experience developing business documents and leadership presentations with clear, compelling communicationsAbility to understand business questions and issues, think strategically, synthesize information quicklyAbility to work in a team to understand business requirements and provide viable automated solutionsAbility to independently manage deadlines while multitasking between different projects; strong results-oriented project management skills with a high attention to detailWho We Are TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you‚Äôve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we‚Äôre here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing ‚Äì and so will you.Our Total Rewards PackageOur Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Learn moreAdditional Information:We‚Äôre delighted that you‚Äôre considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we‚Äôre committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.Please be advised that this job opportunity is subject to provincial regulation for employment purposes. It is imperative to acknowledge that each province or territory within the jurisdiction of Canada may have its own set of regulations, requirements.Colleague Development If you‚Äôre interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You‚Äôll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD ‚Äì and we‚Äôre committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.Training & OnboardingWe will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you‚Äôve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.Interview Process We‚Äôll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.Accommodation Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you‚Äôd like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.We look forward to hearing from you!Language Requirement:N/A.

title: Global Banking and Markets - THRIVE Summer Internship Program (Canada) - Summer 2025
description: Requisition ID: 207239Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.Term: May ‚Äì August 2025Application Deadline: 10/6/2024Posted pursuant to Scotiabank‚Äôs Special Measure Program under the Employment Equity Act and Canadian Human Rights Act.Why work for Scotiabank?Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. This is a place where you‚Äôll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we're committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.Colleague Development If you're interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You'll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD ‚Äì and we're committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.Training & OnboardingWe will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you've got everything you need to succeed in your new role.Interview Process We'll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. title: Project Management Intern - Master‚Äôs Level Internship
description: Level: Master‚Äôs Level Internship (with some professional experience)Team: Chief of Staff OfficeStatus: Full-timeDuration: Equivalent to minimum 520 Hours (or 3 months minimum)Work location: Remote (with hybrid options in Toronto and Chicago only)Compensation: Hourly (paid in equity compensation equivalent to CAD $32/hour)Company OverviewAt Vosyn, we embrace the exciting, game-changing world of Artificial Intelligence, driving innovation and pioneering impactful projects across various industries. Our incubator, AI Venture Lab, nestled in the heart of Office146.com, is a crucible of entrepreneurial spirit, supported by intelligent processes and industry-leading best practices. Currently, we‚Äôre at the forefront of a significant IPO endeavor, a truly unicorn in the making. We invite you to be part of our journey and leave your imprint on the future of AI. At Vosyn, you will have the opportunity to engage with a fast-growing global organization with diversity of thought, experience, and cultures.Additional PerksBe part of the invigorating journey of a start-up transitioning to an IPO.Engage directly with senior management and strategic advisory board members.Enhance your CV with a rich array of experiences unique to Vosyn and AI Venture Lab.Get priority consideration for future full-time roles post-internship placement.Gain valuable experience with shaping and developing all facets of a world class HR department, while embracing the ‚Äòexperiential learning‚Äô that comes from work in a fast paced global company.About The JobWe are seeking a Project Management Intern to join our dynamic team and contribute to innovative projects in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI). As an intern, you will gain hands-on experience in project management practices, collaborating closely with our PMO to support the planning, execution, and monitoring of key projects. This internship offers a fully immersive experience, whether remote or hybrid (Toronto or Chicago), providing a unique opportunity to develop your project management skills in a high-growth environment.What You‚Äôll DoAssist in developing project plans, schedules, and resource allocation.Prepare project documentation, including status reports, meeting minutes, and project deliverables.Coordinate project activities, ensuring that project goals are met on time and within scope.Facilitate communication between project stakeholders, including team members, senior management, and external partners.Identify and report potential project risks, developing mitigation strategies in collaboration with the PMO.Track project progress, assist in performance analysis, and prepare reports for stakeholders.About YouMust be pursuing or recently completed a Master‚Äôs degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.5+ years experience in senior project management roles and efficient in utilizing the PM tools.Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage time effectively.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to engage effectively with team members and stakeholders.Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving abilities.Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with project management tools such as Microsoft Project, Asana, or Trello.A proactive and detail-oriented approach to work, with a passion for continuous improvement.At Vosyn, you will have the opportunity to engage with a fast-growing global organization with a diversity of thought, experience, and cultures. Our interns have come from some of the top universities all around the world and we invite you to join us on this exciting journey.DeiAt Vosyn Inc., we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where every employee feels valued and supported. We believe that diversity of thought, background, and experience enriches our company culture and enhances innovation. We are an equal-opportunity employer and encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply.Application MethodPlease apply via our career site: https://vosyn.ai/careers/

title: Investments, Summer 2025 - Toronto (Co-op/Internship)
description: About QuadReal Property GroupQuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia. Its assets under management total $77.6 billion. From its foundation in Canada as a full-service real estate operating company, QuadReal has expanded its capabilities to invest in equity and debt in both the public and private markets. QuadReal invests directly, via programmatic partnerships and through operating platforms in which it holds an ownership interest.QuadReal seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come.QuadReal: Excellence lives here.www.quadreal.comWe are committed to providing our Co-ops/Interns with a student experience that provides a supportive and engaging learning environment while developing skills and business acumen. Students will have the opportunity to participate in a variety of experiences including our Corporate Speaker Series, Fireside Chats, Volunteer opportunities and Networking events.Eligibility Note: To qualify for a student (Co-op/Internship) opportunity, students must be enrolled in their academic studies at a post-secondary institution (university/college) and must be returning to school after completion of their work term with QuadReal. If you are a student registered in an official co-op program at your post-secondary institution and completion of a final work term is a mandatory component for you to graduate, you are eligible to apply with the understanding that you will leave QuadReal at the end of your work term or have the possibility to be considered for full-time opportunities.Based in Toronto, the Co-op/ Intern, Investments, will report to the Manager, Investments, and support QuadReal‚Äôs Investment team. The intern will assist the team in evaluating and reporting the performance of the investment portfolio, conducting acquisition and disposition underwriting, managing transactions and joint venture relationships, executing strategies for the development pipeline and producing investment memorandums, letters of recommendation, research reports, brochures and studies to drive decision making.What We OfferAn organization and leaders that support your development through meaningful work experienceA Student Mentorship Program designed to provide 1:1 support throughout your experienceOpportunities to build your industry knowledge through Corporate Speaker Series & Fireside ChatsGiving back to community with your peers and team members through volunteering eventsOpportunities to build long lasting industry and professional relationshipsWhat You Will ExperienceWork with the investment teams to prepare return calculations and analysis for potential transactions, including the creation of cashflow models to anticipate future performance and the presentation of financial modelling outputs and conclusionsPerform market research for investment opportunities, evaluate past investment financial performance, gather data on competitor ‚Äì or other comparable ‚Äì product, and help interpret the economic backdrop behind investmentsTrack market data pertaining to real estate investments within the BC region, aiming to create a comprehensive database for use by the investment teamsAssist in the creation of approval memorandums for the purposes of new acquisitions, development & construction of existing development assets within the development pipeline, and disposition of non-strategic assets both within the income producing and development portfolioAssist in periodic development updates, providing support to the development and portfolio management teams in creating new cashflow forecasts and budgetary inputsAnalyze and review quarterly reports, financial statements and investment documentsPartner with colleagues to prepare internal reporting using your strong writing and presentation acumen to summarize portfolio performance and deliver insight for key stakeholders, including QuadReal‚Äôs Board of Directors and senior management teamsWhat You Will BringCurrently enrolled in an academic program preferably in Real Estate, Finance, Mathematics/Statistic or Economics. Working towards CFA is considered an assetStrong quantitative and analytical skills; detail-oriented and proficient in building and handling complicated data setsExcellent communication and presentation skills; demonstrate an ability to effectively communicate and present results that articulate key themes and messagesAdvanced knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and Word; knowledge of Argus Enterprise a plusPrevious experience working within a real estate company (asset management or development), real estate brokerage or advisory firm, appraisal firm, or real estate lender is desirable. A strong interest in developing a career within real estate is essentialDon‚Äôt have all of the above skills? Don‚Äôt worry. We still want to hear from you!QuadReal will provide reasonable accommodation at any time throughout the hiring process for applicants with disabilities or for those needing job postings in an alternate format. If you require accommodation, please advise the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with and include the following: Job posting #, your name and your preferred method of contact.Want to learn about our end-to-end recruitment process? Click this link for a short video that will take you through each step, so you‚Äôll know exactly what to expect.

title: Engineering Intern
description: FM is a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses, providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles.Imagine a career in which you are having one-of-a-kind work experiences helping clients identify and understand what could go wrong. Our Consultant Engineers evaluate risk and reward, calculate potential disaster and anticipate ways to protect against nature‚Äôs greatest forces. Built on trust, communication and technology, we will give you the training to work with a large variety of clients to protect their business operations from fire, natural disasters, mechanical breakdown and other types of property risk.If you enjoy variety, put your time‚Äêmanagement and organization skills to use partaking in field visits, office work, and projects.Through special projects, job shadowing, and real work, both in the office and out in the field, you can enhance your skills and build knowledge. At FM, you'll deepen your practical engineering knowledge and pave your road to success by taking an immersive journey into our business.Explore our unique business model and key differentiators through training, research, and first-hand experience. Shadow employees in a range of departments, attend meetings, and experience being a part of the FM team. Gain exposure to our training program for consultant engineers, access on-demand learning sessions across a range of topics. Learn how to apply our loss prevention standards for FM clients. Join our engineers in the field and live a "day in the life" of a consultant engineer. Assist with special projects and see how engineering data is used throughout the company.ResponsibilitiesDuring the internship, you will be given assignments of limited scope and complexity giving you the opportunity to learn. The intern would be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:Participating in FM training to learn the fundamentals of building construction, occupancy, protection and exposures (COPE) as it relates to risk assessment and risk mitigation.Learning the fundamentals of fire protection systems.Trailing FM Field Engineers during their visits to commercial properties of varying complexity and learn how to perform ‚Äúhands‚Äêon‚Äù site assessments of the physical property, including roofs. Reviewing mechanical and electrical equipment operation, installation, maintenance and loss potential hazards.Communicating basic recommendations and/or engineering solutions to ensure client understanding and agreement for risk improvement. Documenting risk analysis of locations visited.Leading and delivering a technical project to be determined by FM Supervisors.Shadowing professionals in various departments within FM to gain a holistic understanding of the company and engineering team. Visiting other FM locations (such as the Corporate offices and research campus). Participating in professional development events with other interns.Successful Consultant Engineer Interns Have The Following QualificationsPlan to graduate with a bachelors degree in engineering (civil, chemical, mechanical, electrical, etc.) or fire protection;Ability to work F/T during summer internship;Strong verbal and written communications skills; Good analytical, organizational, problem solving, and interpersonal skills; Efficient time management skills;Naturally inquisitive with the ability to undertake and deliver projects with minimal supervision; Solid technical aptitude including diverse knowledge of engineering principles; Valid driver‚Äôs license and access to a vehicle throughout internship; Ability to commute to Toronto Operations (Vaughan, ON) throughout internship; Physical ability to climb ladders, lift >25 lbs., balance, and work at elevated heights; Proficient in MS Office products.You will be expected to work independentlyFM is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce.

title: Intern - Investments, Total Fund Management, Beta Management (Winter 2025- 12 Month Contract)
description: The Deadline To Apply For This Role IsUntil 11:59 PM of August 27, 2024The OpportunityJanuary 2025 - December 2025When you work in an internship role in the Total Fund Management department you will have an engaging work experience where you can apply your analytical skills and passion for markets at a leading investment firm while experiencing the dynamic nature of the trading floor environment. This ‚Äúfull immersion‚Äù experience unfolds in a friendly and open environment where you will work side by side with highly experienced investment professionals and more recent graduates. We embrace diversity of thought and pride ourselves in our strong learning culture. You will be encouraged to offer your opinion and develop both market expertise and strengthen interpersonal skills. As an added benefit, our interns have access to industry tools, research, and the opportunity to interact with traders, portfolio managers and economic researchers.Who You‚Äôll Work WithWe are looking for an intern to join our Beta Management team within Total Fund Management. Beta Management provides best-in-class management of our passive cross-asset investment portfolio including implementation of changes to our asset mix using a combination of both derivative and cash instruments. The team consists of subject matter experts across all asset classes, proficient in accessing and maintaining Total Fund exposures efficiently.What You'll DoAs an intern in Total Fund Management, you will be encouraged to make the most of your experience at OTPP by asking questions and getting involved in our daily business right from the start. Total Fund Management encourages the development of their interns and offers a unique experience with direct exposure to markets in an institutional capacity.Throughout the internship, you will work with a team of portfolio managers across the equity, fixed income, commodity, credit and foreign exchange asset classes. The successful candidate will gain experience in managing our asset mix positions while supporting the Fund‚Äôs risk-adjusted return targets subject to our internal constraints including risk, liquidity and leverage.Situated on the trading floor, each day will present unique challenges that require teamwork, collaboration and real-time problem solving across global markets. As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to tackle ad-hoc issues and develop tools that enhance analytics to support investment decision-making. The role involves regular interaction with the trading team to ensure seamless market access for position management.What You'll NeedYou are enrolled in your 3rd or 4th year of undergraduate studies or pursuing graduate studies.You are naturally inquisitive and demonstrate a proactive approach to learning and problem-solving.You aspire to thrive in a dynamic environment and can work well within a team setting.You have strong skills in programming concepts, with proficiency in Python and SQL.You have experience in creating dashboards, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI being an asset.While your specific field of study is flexible, we encourage applications from those with a strong academic record and a shared passion for financial markets.You must be enrolled in a co-op program or returning to your studies after the work term is completed.What We‚Äôre OfferingNumerous opportunities for professional growth and development, including lunch and learnsStudent led team building events on a monthly basisEmployee discount programs including Edvantage and PerkopolisAt Ontario Teachers', diversity is one of our core strengths. We take pride in ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create, reflect and embrace diversity of thought, background and experience. Through our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion strategy and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), we celebrate diversity and foster inclusion through events for colleagues to connect for professional development, networking & mentoring. We are building an inclusive and equitable workplace where our talent is respected, accepted and empowered to be themselves. To learn more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, check out Life at Teachers'.How To ApplyAre you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Apply today! The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:ResumeCopy of your transcriptsYou will also be invited to complete a pre-recorded digital interview as part of your application.We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.Accommodations are available upon request (peopleandculture@otpp.com) for candidates with a disability taking part in the recruitment process and once hired.The privacy of your personal information is important to us. Please visit our Privacy Centre to learn how we handle your personal information.Functional AreasAdministrationRequisition ID5934
